attributes.action: wait until a significant number of complaints about a TV or radio broadcast have been received before reacting.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Jeremy Clarkson, Jonathan Ross, Russell Brand, all the subject of recent complaints to Ofcom. with the Clarkson example; approximately 8 million UK viewres watch Top Gear and at the last count about 1800 people had complained (0.0225%) about his remarks. Surely this means that the great majority of peolpe are not offended and this issue not not worhty of regulatory attention. Ditto with the Jonathan Ross/Russell Brand issue. Surely 0.0225% is not a sigificant number?

reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
